I originally wrote this as a blog post for the Harvard Business Review, titled “The Unimportance of Practically Everything,” back on May 29, 2012. 

Richard Koch has explored the 80/20 principle in several books, like *The 80/20 Principle: The Secret of Achieving More with Less* (1997), *The Power Laws* (2000), and *The 80/20 Revolution* (2002). He also wrote *Living the 80/20 Way* (2004). 

Warren Buffett is quoted in Koch's *The 80/20 Individual*. 

Mary Buffett and David Clark also shared insights from Warren Buffett in *The Tao of Warren Buffett: Warren Buffett’s Words of Wisdom* (2006). 

In the blog post “The Unimportance of Practically Everything,” I had a conversation with someone at a meeting hosted by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation in Seattle. He confirmed he believed in the idea I presented. 

John Maxwell discussed leadership in his book *Developing the Leader Within You* (1993).

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The concept of essentialism emphasizes the importance of focusing on what truly matters by recognizing the unimportance of practically everything else.
